intro: Lyonia papayoensis, commonly known as the papaya lyonia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as under the canopy of rainforests. Its leaves are elliptical with a smooth texture and a slightly waxy surface. The flowers are usually white or pale yellow, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
